name: Base FHIR Capability Statement (Full)
description: This is the base Capability Statement for FHIR. It represents a server that provides the full set of functionality defined by FHIR. It is provided to use as a template for system designers to build their own Capability Statements from

rest.documentation: All the functionality defined in FHIR

security.description: This is the Capability Statement to declare that the server supports SMART-on-FHIR. See the SMART-on-FHIR docs for the extension that would go with such a server

searchParam.documentation: AE | PAE An adverse event is an event that caused harm to a patient,  an adverse reaction is a something that is a subject-specific event that is a result of an exposure to a medication, food, device or environmental substance, a potential adverse event is something that occurred and that could have caused harm to a patient but did not

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: The unique identity for a particular sequence

searchParam.name: coordinate
searchParam.documentation: Search parameter for region of the reference DNA sequence string. This will refer to part of a locus or part of a gene where search region will be represented in 1-based system. Since the coordinateSystem can either be 0-based or 1-based, this search query will include the result of both coordinateSystem that contains the equivalent segment of the gene or whole genome sequence. For example, a search for sequence can be represented as `coordinate=1$lt345$gt123`, this means it will search for the Sequence resource on chromosome 1 and with position >123 and <345, where in 1-based system resource, all strings within region 1:124-344 will be revealed, while in 0-based system resource, all strings within region 1:123-344 will be revealed. You may want to check detail about 0-based v.s. 1-based above.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The subject that the observation is about

searchParam.name: chromosome
searchParam.documentation: Chromosome number of the reference sequence

searchParam.name: start
searchParam.documentation: Start position (0-based inclusive, 1-based inclusive, that means the nucleic acid or amino acid at this position will be included) of the reference sequence.

searchParam.name: end
searchParam.documentation: End position (0-based exclusive, which menas the acid at this position will not be included, 1-based inclusive, which means the acid at this position will be included) of the reference sequence.

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: Amino Acid Sequence/ DNA Sequence / RNA Sequence
